Clarke stood by and listened to Micheal Moore call the President a deserter and Clarke did not have the personal integrity to tell Moore to stop lying. Clarke will never get my vote. He was dismissed as Supreme Commander in Europe for "reasons concerning his lack of integrity". That comment from Clintons Chief of Staff.

Clark's a seemingly stoic and tacit man, and he lacks the fire and charisma I'd like to see in a candidate. Dean's too extreme and his concession holler was a bit XXXXX.
 I think I'll go with Kerry on this. Assuming Bush doesn't change vp's the next election I think the Dem's might have a good chance here.

Clarke stood by and listened to Micheal Moore call the President a deserter and Clarke did not have the personal integrity to tell Moore to stop lying. Clarke will never get my vote. He was dismissed as Supreme Commander in Europe for "reasons concerning his lack of integrity". That comment from Clintons Chief of Staff.

 
 
 Clark does seem to have made a relatively serious polical mistake here, but he is afterall a political newcomer. I am not sure if he does, but I could understand why, though, Clark would have some animosity toward someone who was able to get out of Vietnam while he went there and saw his friends die because they did not have the money or political connections to get out of it.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Clarkes done it again
